channel.title: Blogs on Data Whale
channel.description: Recent content in Blogs on Data Whale

item.title: Public Option Premium Change Illustration By Rating Area
item.description: Illustrate Federal Premium Spending Impact of Public Option Policy Interventions.

item.title: Data dashboard showcase - World Bank Solar Water Pumping Data
item.description: This online interactive data dashboard aims to raise awareness about the technology and provide resources that help incorporate it into operations.

item.title: Data dashboard showcase - World Bank IEG Data
item.description: This dashboard contains ratings data on World Bank lending projects that closed between fiscal years 2008 and 2019 and for which IEG received Implementation Completion and Results Reports (ICRs).

item.title: Unleash the Green Finance Potential in Emerging Markets: How MDBs work with China on Green Bonds
item.description: Green bond financing, as a blended finance model, could innovatively channel the private investments to achieve the Sustainable Development Goals.

item.title: Worldwide Trend in Access to Sanitation Services
item.description: Using data from the WHO/UNICEF Joint Monitoring Programme for Water Supply, Sanitation and Hygiene obtained through the World Bank Open Data, an animated chart is created about the indicator “people using at least basic sanitation services (as a percent of population)” for 192 countries around the world from 2000 to 2017.

item.title: Understanding the infrastructure background and patterns of China’s E-Commerce Boom
item.description: Visualization Series of China’s E-Commerce Sector and Underlying Transport Infrastructure.

item.title: Interative data story showcase
item.description: Remember that time when you were reading an article online, where half-way through, there’s an advertisement that caught your eye, and 10 minutes later, you finished purchasing whatever that was and completely forgot about the article? The designers of ePIRLS surely remember such moments, so they put advertisements in many webpages from which students are supposed to read and collect information.

item.title: Analyzing business ownership using Census data
item.description: How many businesses in the United States are owned by women or minorities? Does the ownership vary by industry and region?

item.title: Instagram @WeThePeopleDC
item.description: If you have some footprints in Washington D.C. and are active on Instagram, chances are that you may have heard of, or are currently following, the Instagram account @WeThePeopleDC.

item.title: Introducing the metro.data R package
item.description: metro.data metro.data is an R package for working with US Census geographic data. The built-in datasets include latest geographic reference files between census places, counties, metropolitan areas, and states, with population data from 2018 ACS 1-year estimates and employment data from CBP 2018 estimates.
